main event: On August 25, 1961, several witnesses reported seeing shiny white, starlike objects with a red dot attached, believed to be balloons.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for about 20 minutes., The object seemed to have burst and emitted a red light, likely an anti-collision light., Originally, the objects were thought to be weather balloons but their height suggested they were still in sunlight., Witnesses reported seeing a flash of light that moved horizontally and then up and down rapidly., A letter was sent to Project Blue Book requesting a positive explanation for the sightings.
sighted object: shiny white starlike objects with a red dot
witness description: Shirley Anne Hays and a 13-year-old male resident from Silverside Heights
